title: Prospect Theory: Why We Gamble with Losses
description: One-minute skill: Prospect Theory: Why We Gamble with Losses.

hook.text: You'll refuse a fair coin flip for $1,000 â€” too risky. But if you're already down $1,000, you'll flip to get it back.

buildup.text: Kahneman and Tversky's prospect theory showed we're risk-averse with gains but risk-seeking with losses.

discovery.text: When winning, we play safe to protect gains. When losing, we gamble recklessly hoping to break even.

twist.text: This explains why traders double down on losing positions. The loss puts them in 'gambling mode' â€” chasing recovery.

climax.text: Prospect theory won Kahneman the Nobel Prize.

punchline.text: Losing money doesn't make us careful. It makes us reckless.

quiz.question: According to prospect theory, how do people behave when facing losses?
options: They become risk-seeking, gambling to recover losses
